104.sentence_1: To be safest, just assume that everything you bring is going to get wet.
104.sentence_2: To be safest <as you pack>, just assume that everything you bring is going to get wet.
104.context_before: At the very least, aim to drink 16oz or more of water in the hour leading up to your swim. Stuff phones, electronics, and valuables in resealable plastic bags.
104.context_after: If you are taking things like your mobile phone that can't get wet, take them in a separate small bag, pockets of your clothes or a waterproof bag which you can put in your swimming bag.

105.sentence_1: In the event that an intruder does enter your home, you should have a plan in place for you and your family to get out safely.
105.sentence_2: In the event that an intruder does enter your home or <should a fire breakout>, you should have a plan in place for you and your family to get out safely.
105.context_before:
Also, should an issue arise, you might want to call your neighbors to alert them so that they can protect their house from danger as well. 
 5. Develop an exit plan.
105.context_after: That plan may include everyone coming to your room and then leaving through the window. Talk to your family about this plan so that everyone is on the same page.    * Consider posting the plan to the refrigerator so that no one forgets.   6. Consider getting a dog.

106.sentence_1: Use an orange stick to gently push back the cuticles.
106.sentence_2: Use an orange stick, <rather than a metal pusher>, to gently push back the cuticles.
106.context_before:
* If you do not want to use harsh vinegar, however, you can soak the nails in warm, soapy water for five minutes. 
 3. Push back the cuticles.
106.context_after: In doing so, you can expose more of the nail and prevent nail polish from getting on the skin.    * Never cut the cuticles. Cutting a cuticle leaves a gap open in between the nail and the skin, which could result in nail infections or other problems that will affect the appearance and health of the nail.   4. Apply petroleum jelly around the cuticles.

107.sentence_1: Bring a water bottle with you into the room.
107.sentence_2: Bring a water bottle with you into the room <to drink periodically>.
107.context_before:
Turn on the hot water and let it run until the room is steamy. 
     * Wet a washcloth with cold water and apply it to your neck or forehead if you feel lightheaded. 
 *
107.context_after: Keep yourself hydrated for the duration of the bath.  4. Sit in the steam for 10-15 minutes. Before you enter the bath, relax and let the steam work into your skin. If you feel lightheaded, open a door or window and drink more water.

108.sentence_1: Wear a leather jacket over a floral summer dress.
108.sentence_2: Wear a leather jacket over a floral summer dress <for an edgy touch>.
108.context_after: The combination of a feminine floral pattern and a structured leather jacket gives your cute outfit a touch of edge. This look also works well for both daytime and nighttime.  2. Wear a dressier coat to make the outfit stylish and work-appropriate. Options such as a camel coat, a lightweight trench coat, and a thick blazer look especially good with a midi-length dress or a shift dress.
